name: Asana
description:
Nothing great is made alone, so why should we manage our projects that way? Asana and Figma work together to help teams move work forward—no matter which tool they’re in.


In FigJam, you can use the Asana widget to pull Asana projects and all of their associated tasks into the canvas to discuss and update as a team. Adjust due dates, assignees, tags, sections, projects, and any custom fields right in FigJam, while maintaining your source of truth in Asana. And, if new to-dos come up in a meeting, you can capture them on stickies and then instantly convert them to tasks in Asana.


Get started with the Asana widget for FigJam:

  1. Click “Install” at the top right of this page
  2. Open a FigJam file
  3. On the tool bar, click the button at the far right and search for “Asana” 
  4. Select the Asana widget to insert it into your document
  5. Sign into your Asana account via the prompt
  6. To bring an Asana project into FigJam, select “Import” on the widget and paste in the URL of the project you’d like to import
  7. To edit a task or see more details, select the task and then select “Show meta data” in the tool bar
  8. To turn stickies into Asana tasks, select one or more stickies, then select “Convert selected stickies to tasks” on the widget


---

Learn more about how to use this widget with your team and try it out for yourself in this playground file: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1103759573623690161/
